meanings.definition: A person or thing that converts something.
meanings.sent1: The convertor helped change the old documents into digital files.
meanings.sent2: The machine acted as a convertor, turning sunlight into electricity.
meanings.sent3: The convertor at the recycling plant was known for its magic touch.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a convertor, transforming sadness into joy.
meanings.sent5: The convertor was like a wizard, turning words into pictures.

meanings.definition: A device that converts one form of energy into another.
meanings.sent1: The solar panel was a convertor, changing sunlight into power.
meanings.sent2: The wind turbine acted as a convertor, converting wind energy into electricity.
meanings.sent3: The convertor at the power plant had a sunny disposition.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was a convertor, turning silence into music.
meanings.sent5: The convertor hummed softly, transforming energy into light.

meanings.definition: A program that changes the format of a file.
meanings.sent1: The convertor software quickly altered the image file to a PDF.
meanings.sent2: The video editing program served as a convertor, changing video formats effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The convertor app had a knack for making files look their best.
meanings.sent4: His words were a convertor, reshaping reality into stories.
meanings.sent5: The convertor program worked like magic, turning text into images.
